summary: An email from a prosecutor (likely from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) thanking colleagues for assistance with a meeting with victims and requesting permission to travel to Palm Beach for a proffer session with an Epstein co-conspirator. It indicates an active investigation into co-conspirators following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his co-conspirators are the focus of the ongoing probe mentioned in the email.

events.title: Meeting with Victims
events.description: Prosecutors met with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, which was described as helpful to the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Planned Proffer Session in Palm Beach
events.description: Prosecutors plan to travel to Palm Beach to conduct a proffer session (a meeting where a suspect or witness offers information) with an Epstein co-conspirator.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Epstein's co-conspirators as of August 2019, following Epstein's death.
Prosecutors successfully met with victims on August 27, 2019, and found the meeting very helpful to the investigation.
A proffer session with an Epstein co-conspirator was planned for early September 2019 in Palm Beach, indicating a key witness or suspect was cooperating or being interviewed.
The email shows standard prosecutorial procedures, including requesting travel permission and booking secure conference rooms for sensitive meetings.
